info.title: Student Finance Administration API
info.description: XF Student Finance Administration Integration (XAI) API

post.summary: Search GL accounts for multiple school codes
post.description:
Given multiple school codes in the request body, the interface responds with a list of GL accounts
found for each supplied location.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page that the user wants to return. The value must be greater than or equal to one.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of results per page the user wants to return.

requestBody.description: Accepts a list of one or more school codes (locations)

401.description: Bad or expired token. Re-authenticate the user to fix.

403.description: Bad OIDC / OAuth2 request (wrong consumer key, bad nonce, expired timestamp etc).

get.summary: Get a list of GL accounts for a single location.
get.description: Given a single school code in the request URI, the interface responds with a list of GL accounts located for the supplied school code.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page that the user wants to return. The value must be greater than or equal to one.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of results per page the user wants to return.

401.description: Bad or expired token. Re-authenticate the user to fix.

403.description: Bad OIDC / OAuth2 request (wrong consumer key, bad nonce, expired timestamp etc).

404.description: Data for the requested input value could not be located.

post.summary: Search multiple school locations for signs of handling the petty cash
post.description:
Given multiple school codes in the request body, the interface responds with a list of school codes and a corresponding
flag for each location indicating whether the school in question handles the petty cash or not.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page that the user wants to return. The value must be greater than or equal to one.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of results per page the user wants to return.

requestBody.description: Accepts a list of one or more school codes (locations)

401.description: Bad or expired token. Re-authenticate the user to fix.

403.description: Bad OIDC / OAuth2 request (wrong consumer key, bad nonce, expired timestamp etc).

get.summary: Get a petty cash handling indicator for a given school location.
get.description:
Given a single school code in the request URI, the interface responds with the school code and a flag
indicating whether the school location in question handles the petty cash or not.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page that the user wants to return. The value must be greater than or equal to one.

Base32Type.title: Base32Type
Base32Type.description:
Base32 type used to encode the correlationID using the Universally Unique Lexicographically
Sortable Identifier (ULID, https://github.com/ulid/spec) as an alternative to UUID v4.
Base32 is used as shown. This alphabet excludes the letters I, L, O, and U to avoid confusion and abuse.

HTTPStatusType.title: HTTPStatusType
HTTPStatusType.description: A subset of HTTP status codes and phrases.

AuditEventType.title: AuditEventType

correlationID.description:
In most cases, it will be a copy of the correlation ID header.
In cases when an external system supplies its own transaction ID, use this field to copy the external transaction ID into it.

actor.description:
Use to preserve the name of the system that initiates the event.
For incoming requests, use the remote system name, such as SAP or the source API name, if known.
For outgoing requests, use the API's own deployment name, such as dev-core-student-v1-nsw-edu-au.
If the source name can't be established or derived, use the default value.

operation.description:
Operation, or flow, or subflow, or the interface name - depending on the context.
For API's, use the operationId value from the OAS v3 specification.
For web services, supply the web service operation name.
Use metadata when providing the metadata information about a specific resource (maps from HEAD or OPTIONS HTTP verbs).

eventType.description: For REST API's, map the HTTP verb onto one of the above. For web services, select the eventType based on the semantics of the operation.

references.description:
Use to map any extra external identifiers available in the request.
Examples include: SAP batch or file name, system user-id's etc.
It must be supplied as a JSON map: [ { "key1": "value1" }, { "key2": "value2" } ]

resources.description:
Use to provide information of resource the operation is acting upon, if readily available.
Examples include SRN's, queue names, Kafka topic, stream or table names.
It must be supplied as a JSON map: [ { "key1": "value1" }, { "key2": "value2" } ].
For Kafka, use { "topic": "XAI_Finance_Confirmations" }

AuditEventType.description: Audit event type to allow to preserve the full event metadata

AuditTrailType.title: AuditTrailType
AuditTrailType.description: Audit trail type for each received request (before forwarding on) and each generated response (before being relayed back to the caller)

EventMetadataType.title: Kafka event metadata type
EventMetadataType.description:
Event metadata that is used to facilitate the event discovery, event correlation
for application, monitoring and troublshooting purposes.

SchoolCodeType.description: A numeric school code represented as a four digit text string

FinanceSystemType.description: Vendor specific unique finance system name

FeeValueType.description: A positiveInteger(10) value representing the fee value

FinanceProviderDocumentType.description: Document number in SAP after posting

invoiceNumber.description: Invoice number generated in SAP for Commercial receipts.

customer.description: Business partner (customer) name created in SAP.

BankDepositType.description: Bank deposit type for transactions with payment method CASH, CHEQUE, MONEY ORDER

ReceiptsType.title: ReceiptsType
ReceiptsType.description:
Revenue and refunds event type to post receipts and refunds from Student finance applications to SAP,
in order to post into the SAP General Ledger.

PettyCashResponseType.title: PettyCashResponseType
PettyCashResponseType.description: Petty cash response type indicating whether a particular school still handles the petty cash

firstName.description:
For people with single names this field need not be present.
The single name should be in the lastName field.

lastName.description: For people with single names the single name should be in this field

isPreferred.description:
May be true for one and only one entry to indicate the preferred phone number.
Assumed to be 'false' if not present.

purpose.description: The purpose of the number as specified by the customer

countryCode.description: If absent, assumed to be Australia (+61). The + should be included

areaCode.description: Required for non Mobile Phones, if field is present and refers to Australian code - the leading 0 should be omitted.

number.description: The actual phone number, with leading zeros as appropriate

fullNumber.description:
Fully formatted phone number with country code, area code, number and extension
incorporated. Formatted according to section 5.1.4. of [RFC 3966](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3966.txt)

mailingName.description: Name of the individual or business formatted for inclusion in an address used for physical mail

addressLine1.description: First line of the standard address object

addressLine2.description: Second line of the standard address object

addressLine3.description: Third line of the standard address object

city.description: Name of the city or locality

stateName.description: Fully worded state or territory name if the country is not Australia.

countryCode.description: A valid [ISO 3166 Alpha-3](https://www.iso.org/iso-3166-country-codes.html) country code. Australia (AUS) is assumed if country is not present.

countryName.description: Full country name, defaults to Australia.

ConfirmationType.description: SAP outbound receipt, refund and mandatory fee confirmation type

AustralianStateType.description:
If country is Australia then must be one of the values defined
by the [State Type Abbreviation](https://auspost.com.au/content/dam/auspost_corp/media/documents/australia-post-data-guide.pdf)
in the PAF file format: NSW, QLD, VIC, NT, WA, SA, TAS, ACT, AAT

BankBranchAddressType.description:
Bank branch address type. Replicates the Consumer Data Standards' CommonSimpleAddress
with exception of the post code being optional.

TransactionSignageType.description:
debit for debit charges or + in SAP terms
credit for credits (such as refunds) or - in SAP terms

EPaymentType.description: Credit card payment gateway information type

method.description:
SAP supports following payment methods:
  CASH  maps onto cash
  CHEQUE  maps onto cheque
  MONEYORDER  maps onto money-order
  EPAY  maps onto epay. ePayments, e.g. credit card payments through the parent portal.
  EFTPOS - maps onto eftpos
  THIRDPARTY  maps onto third-party. Previously known as payment method NFB  Not for Banking.
    For all EFT payments received as direct deposit into the DoE bank account, corresponding
    transactions from a student finance system received in SAP with payment method THIRDPARTY.
    Example includes payments from Centrelink.
  REFEFTPOS  maps onto eftpos-refund
  REFEPAY  maps onto epay-refund
  REFCSH  maps onto cash-refund
  REFEFT  maps onto eft-refund
  REFCHEQUE  maps ontp cheque-refund
When a reverse mapping is required, run the above mapping guidelines backward.

RevenueType.description: Enumeration of available payment types that encompass both, receipts, refunds, adjustments and edge cases

FinanceProviderType.description: Finance system provider specific data type

MandatoryFeeType.description: Mandatory fee vendor facing data type

RefundBaseType.description: Nominated specialised EFT refund vendor facing interface type

designation.description:
For external refunds, set to external to indicate that payment to be made by Accounts Payable.
Otherwise use the default value.

refundTransactionID.description: Refund transaction ID with school code prefixing the refund transaction line ID (see below)

ChequeRefundType.description: Nominated refund (e.g. cheque or EFT) vendor facing interface type

EFTRefundType.description: Nominated specialised EFT refund vendor facing interface type

BSBResponseType.description:
BSB details are conveyed from SAP to a student finance application as the BSB details are required
in Student finance application to properly validate and process refunds.

BusinessPartnerType.description: Business partner type describes a business entity that provides services to a school

channel.description:
Use the inbound value to preserve the metadata for the data entering the service.
For requests received from SAP, use the inbound element to copy the SAP request metadata into it.
Use the outbound element to preserve the metadata of the data leaving the service.

depositNumber.description:
6 (six) digit code  begin with school code 'XXXX' appended with '01'.
Note: The bank deposit number is a 6 digit static number, which appears on the Bank Deposit Slip.
This number is found in the deposit book. This is entered for transactions with payment
method CASH, CHEQUE, MONEY ORDER.

runID.description: This is Send To SAPID from the interface requirements.

wasRunOn.description: This is Send To SAP Date from the interface requirements.

groupingID.description:
This is Deposit grouping ID from the interface requirements.
A unique system generated number grouped in the Student finance application by payment methods.
EOD Settlement > Revenue Push (based upon Push to SAP using Deposit Grouping ID)

ReceiptsType_data_financialRun.description: This is the vendor side (financial application)

transactionType.description: This is Transaction type from interface requirements.

wasEnteredOn.description:
This is the Transaction date from interface requirements.

Transaction date is the date the receipt is entered in the Student finance system.
It is possible to have two different transaction dates for the same deposit group ID.

lineID.description: Refund transaction line ID  only applicable to refunds

paymentDate.description: Date on which the payment occurred

FinanceProviderType_data_refund.description: Required if the confirmation is for cheque / EFT refunds only

documentNumber.description: SAP document number  a unique document number SAP generates for each receipt or refund post.

Vendor generated internal document number.
Can be used either for deposit grouping ID or for the invoice group ID  as per interface specifics

Vendor generated internal document number.
Can be used either for deposit grouping ID or for the
invoice group ID  as per interface specifics

Vendor generated internal document number.
Can be used either for deposit grouping ID or for the invoice
group ID  as per interface specifics

BusinessPartnerType_businessParticulars_.description:
Business Partners are what are referred to in SAP as customers.
They are people or organisations/businesses that purchase or lease products or services
from a school e.g. the lease of the school hall/canteen where an invoice has been provided.

financeProcessor.description: Either a cost centre or a WBS element in SAP can be supplied in the request but not both

401.description: Bad or expired token. Re-authenticate the user to fix.

403.description: Bad OIDC / OAuth2 request (wrong consumer key, bad nonce, expired timestamp etc).

404.description: Data for the requested input value could not be located.

page.name: page
page.description: The page that the user wants to return. The value must be greater than or equal to one.

limit.name: limit
limit.description: The number of results per page the user wants to return.
